positive_examples: Under uncertainty, I tend to favor the familiar option.
Ambiguity makes me more risk-averse than I should be.
My discomfort with uncertainty is biasing my choice.
I'm preferring false certainty over acknowledging genuine unknowns.
negative_examples: I can tolerate uncertainty while making reasonable decisions.
Unknown factors are part of the decision context.
I'm comfortable acknowledging what I don't know.
I can act despite incomplete information.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects uncertainty-driven distortions versus healthy uncertainty management. Key markers: tend to favor familiar, discomfort biasing, false certainty, treating unknown as bad.

definition: A signal indicating systematic distortions in judgment under conditions of uncertainty.
